page.title: 02Farming
page.content: {Farming { }The altitude and exposed situation of the farmland in Flockton makes it suitable only for intensive grassland, with small amounts of winter wheat / barley. Stocks limited to sheep, and bought in beef cattle with pockets of small dairy farming. The few sheltered farms grow potatoes, and some grow small amounts of vegetables for stock feeding and personal use. Middlestown and Netherton, at lower levels, are more sheltered, therefore there is a proportionately larger amount of wheat and barley grown, with the acreage of cereal production and intensive grassland approximately equal.
